engine_phase: PHASE 2 — Execution Support (CONFIRMED). Rotation engine consistency check passed. Engine transitions from analytical validation to execution intelligence. 80% execution support, 20% monitoring/scanning.

history.reason: Post Cycle 3: themes established, need depth over novelty. Boost data specificity for unit economics verification. Boost cross-signal reinforcement to detect convergences.
Post Cycle 6 counter-signal revolution: added counter_signal_severity (1.5) and competitive_density (1.3) as permanent grading dimensions.

Post Cycle 8: added market_price_confirmation (1.1) as grading dimension. When equity markets (staffing stocks, sector ETFs) confirm or contradict a thesis, this should modestly adjust scores. Weight is conservative (1.1) because market signals can be noisy — the staffing canary is unusually clean and direct.

running_patterns.description: P2+P5 Divergence Corridor: Professional services in liquidation cascade while healthcare faces permanent labor shortage
running_patterns.cycle_11_note: Pattern persists. No new data this cycle. Rotation engine did not produce signals that challenge or strengthen this pattern.

running_patterns.description: P2+P3 Credit-Squeeze Accelerator: Falling credit availability preventing incumbent restructuring while AI entrants need minimal capital
running_patterns.cycle_11_note: No new data. Capital conditions remain favorable for AI-native entrants.

running_patterns.description: P1+P3 Cost Floor Unlock: 1000x inference cost collapse enabling new tier of agentic businesses
running_patterns.cycle_11_note: No new data. P3 at maximum continues as structural reality enabling Customer Support unit economics.

running_patterns.description: P7 Timing Arbitrage: Companies cutting human capacity before AI can deliver, creating service vacuums
running_patterns.status: confirmed — market-priced, sector-specific, OPERATIVE THESIS for Customer Support PURSUE
running_patterns.cycle_11_note: Strengthened by failure archaeology: Zirtual (2015 VA failure) validates IO propagation chain. Failed startups attempted hard end first — Customer Support IS the correct entry point. Agent B note: the Zirtual finding is genuine new evidence (historical failure pattern independently confirms entry sequence).

running_patterns.description: PE Roll-Up Vulnerability: PE firms deploying $200B+ into fragmented sector roll-ups may face Minsky distress as AI disruption outpaces their restructuring capacity
running_patterns.status: emerging — monitoring for PE stress signals
running_patterns.cycle_11_note: No new PE stress signals. Low priority monitoring continues.

running_patterns.description: Competitive Density as Universal Gate: Every sector flagged by the Principles Engine has already attracted $1B+ in VC/PE. The framework's strength is also its weakness — obvious disruption is obvious to everyone.
running_patterns.status: confirmed — TWO EXCEPTIONS found. Rotation engine confirms density gate operates economy-wide.
running_patterns.cycle_11_note: Rotation engine's 25 quick kills (out of 42 candidates) dramatically reinforce the Universal Gate pattern. The engine scanned broadly and density killed 60% of candidates immediately. This IS genuine new evidence for P-006 — the pattern extends beyond the pipeline to the full economy.

running_patterns.description: Staffing Canary as Macro Leading Indicator: Staffing company equity prices collapse 6-12 months before government employment data confirms structural labor shifts.
running_patterns.status: confirmed — no recovery, awaiting BLS/JOLTS validation Q2-Q3 2026
running_patterns.cycle_11_note: No new data (web tools unavailable). Quarterly monitoring continues.

running_patterns.description: Composite Index Convergence at Maximum: P3 Cost Collapse and Capital Environment both at 100.0 simultaneously
running_patterns.cycle_11_note: No new data. Conditions remain maximally favorable.

running_patterns.description: Three-Layer Competitive Framework: Tool layer, incumbent service layer, and AI-native service layer are structurally distinct markets with different density profiles.
running_patterns.status: validated — 0% kill rescue rate confirms selectivity (Cycle 11)
running_patterns.cycle_11_note: Kill re-scan applied three-layer framework to all 7 killed opportunities. Zero rescued. This IS genuine new evidence: the framework is selective, not permissive. When it identifies sparse service layers (customer support <$500M, vet <$100M), those findings are reliable.

running_patterns.description: BPO Structural Inversion Barrier: BPO incumbents with 300K+ workforces, headcount-based contracts, and human-operations DNA cannot invert to AI-first model within 12-24 months.
running_patterns.cycle_11_note: Agent C identified that P-010 applies most powerfully to DIGITAL service categories where startup unit economics work at small scale. In physical operations (construction, cleaning, logistics), startups fail on unit economics before incumbent inversion barriers matter. P-010 is a DIGITAL-SERVICES pattern, not universal. This refinement is important: it correctly scopes the inversion barrier to Customer Support (digital) while excluding physical ops candidates.

running_patterns.description: Hidden Density: Incumbent AI Adoption as competitive density metric alongside startup funding.
running_patterns.cycle_11_note: No new data this cycle. Incumbent AI adoption rate remains an untracked density metric.

running_patterns.description: Rotation Engine Confirmatory Pattern: When a systematic scan using the SAME analytical framework that built the pipeline finds no better alternatives, this is a CONSISTENCY CHECK, not INDEPENDENT VALIDATION. Consistency means internal coherence. Validation requires external confirmation (customer discovery, revenue, independent assessment).
running_patterns.cycle_11_note: Identified by Agent B. The rotation engine's confirmatory output was characterized by Agent C as 'strongest possible validation.' Agent B reclassifies as 'consistency check passed.' The distinction has strategic implications: 'consistency check' does not justify closing the search entirely, only redirecting capacity from analytical validation to execution support.

methodology_tracking.key_finding_cycle_9: Engine had only ONE discovery method (LLM brainstorming) which exhausted after Cycle 3. Adding bottom-up screener immediately produced 3 new pipeline candidates. Thompson Sampling allocation ensures future cycles systematically try untested methods.
methodology_tracking.key_finding_cycle_10: IO table propagation (first application, previously 0) produced 2 new pipeline candidates (trade finance, commercial insurance) AND the land-and-expand chain for Customer Support. Shift-share decomposition first conceptual application confirmed US-specificity. Cross-domain hypothesis testing (5/6 productive) is the highest-value analytical method this cycle. All previously-untested methods have now been trialed at least once.
methodology_tracking.key_finding_cycle_11: Rotation engine first application: 6-channel systematic scan (42 candidates). Confirmatory rather than generative — zero new INVESTIGATE_FURTHER promotions. Key methodological output: Baumol scanner has tech/finance bias requiring credential-barrier filter recalibration. Three-layer framework validated with 0% kill rescue rate. Agent B reclassifies rotation engine output as 'consistency check' rather than 'independent validation' (P-012).

rotation_engine_findings.calibration_needed: Baumol channel needs credential-barrier filter. Low-wage high-Baumol sectors (education, social work) potentially missed.

methodology_tracking.exploration_budget: 20% of cycle capacity reserved for methods with < 3 applications
methods_trialed_cycle_11: failure_archaeology (genuine new evidence for IO propagation chain)
methodology_tracking.all_methods_status: All methods trialed. Rotation engine adds systematic economy-wide scanning. Future exploration should focus on Baumol recalibration and non-NAICS service categories.

agent_a.kill_index_hit_rate: 0% (0/58 signals matched kill patterns in Cycle 11 — expected given rotation engine's pre-filtering)
agent_a.notes: Cycle 11 Agent A+C produced 58 signals, dominated by rotation engine output (42 candidates + 16 synthesis signals). The rotation engine's 42 candidates were pre-filtered before reaching Agent C, so the 0% kill index hit rate reflects the rotation engine's own filtering, not Agent A signal quality.

agent_b.pursue_rate: 5.0% (1 PURSUE out of 20 total verifications across all cycles)
common_kill_reasons: Regulatory prohibition of core value proposition
Incumbent moat + proven startup failure pattern
Category shrinking (staffing — no entry point even with disruption thesis)
agent_b.notes: Cycle 11 Agent B MAINTAINED Customer Support PURSUE at 72 (no change), MAINTAINED Veterinary at 62 (reversed Agent C's +1 cross-channel validation), and PARKED Wholesale Trade at 50 (down from 53, verdict change from INVESTIGATE_FURTHER). Key contribution: reclassified rotation engine output from 'independent validation' to 'consistency check' (P-012 pattern). Identified execution risks being underweighted (CAC, LATAM retention, SOC 2 compliance, AI edge-case reliability). Updated Mars/Archy risk to 20-30% (from 15-25%). Set hard deadline for Veterinary customer discovery: Cycle 13. Agent B's 85% kill+park rate (17/20) continues to provide confidence that surviving opportunities have been rigorously tested.

criteria: 1. No identified kill-level barrier (regulatory prohibition, precedent failure at 100x+ capital, or competitive density >$500M in target layer)
2. Positive unit economics model with gross margins >30% at estimated scale
3. Sparse competitive density (<$500M) in the specific market layer being targeted
4. Confirmed timing window (>6 months before window closes)
5. Founder fit: team can execute without credentials they don't have
6. Beachhead identified: specific customer segment for initial traction
7. Cross-signal reinforcement: at least 2 independent analytical methods support the thesis
pursue_threshold_criteria.note: Customer Support meets all 7. Veterinary meets 5/7 (missing unit economics validation via customer discovery, and cross-signal reinforcement from Agent B's perspective — the de-exclusivity channel is not truly independent). Wholesale Trade (now PARKED) met 3/7.

critical_risks_to_monitor.cycle_11_status: NO TRIGGER EVENT. Probability UPDATED upward by Agent B (strategic logic for Mars acquiring Archy is compelling).

key_unknowns: EXECUTION: Can the founding team build an MVP AI support pipeline, recruit LATAM agents, and sign pilot customers within 90 days? This is now the DOMINANT unknown. All analytical unknowns are secondary to execution.
TIMING: Is the 10-16 month window accurate? Window is eroding. If execution does not begin by March 2026, downgrade to 8-14 months.
CAC REALITY: Will SaaS mid-market companies actually buy from an unproven AI-first support provider? Sales cycle may be 2-6 months, not 2-4 weeks as modeled.
COMPLIANCE SURFACE: SOC 2, GDPR, and cross-border data handling for AI-first support with LATAM agents — is this a dealbreaker for risk-averse mid-market companies?
LATAM RETENTION: Can LATAM agents be retained in a competitive market, or will the best agents be poached within 6-12 months?
AI EDGE CASES: What happens when the AI mishandles a high-stakes ticket (billing dispute, security incident)? Reputational risk to CLIENT company, not just provider.
ARCHY: What is Archy's actual market penetration in vet PIMS? If >5% of 33K practices, beachhead may be occupied. CRITICAL for Veterinary advancement. Customer discovery required.
MARS STRATEGY: Is Mars's acquisition-led strategy permanent or could one board meeting redirect to software building? Agent B prices this at 20-30% within 24 months.
BLS/JOLTS VALIDATION: Will government employment data confirm the staffing canary signal in Q2-Q3 2026?
BAUMOL BLIND SPOTS: Are education, social work, or other low-wage high-Baumol sectors hiding sparse opportunities that the current scanner misses?
next_cycle_suggestions: PRIORITY 1 — EXECUTION SUPPORT: Customer Support Vacuum Filler. Engine shifts to 80% execution support: GTM strategy, prospect identification, MVP architecture, SOC 2 assessment, LATAM recruitment/retention strategy, pricing model validation.

PRIORITY 2: Veterinary Services customer discovery. HARD DEADLINE: must BEGIN by Cycle 13. 5-10 vet practice owner conversations. Archy competitive intelligence. Domain advisor recruitment. If no discovery by Cycle 13, PARK.
PRIORITY 3: Monitor critical risks R-001 (Sierra AI, 10-15%), R-002 (autonomous agents, 20-30%), R-003 (Mars/Archy, 20-30% UPDATED). Quarterly cadence.
PRIORITY 4: Baumol channel recalibration before next rotation cycle. Add credential-barrier filter. Include low-wage high-Baumol sectors. Distinguish talent-competition wages from cost-disease wages.
PRIORITY 5: Scan IO-propagation candidates (trade finance, commercial insurance) for competitive density. Low priority.
PRIORITY 6: If rotation engine runs again, expand scope: non-US SaaS markets, infrastructure/tooling plays, non-NAICS service categories.
MONITOR: Staffing canary quarterly (RHI, MAN, KELYA). BLS/JOLTS validation expected Q2-Q3 2026.
MONITOR: PE roll-up health (Crete, Ascend, Accrual). Low priority.
PROCESS: Engine is now 80% execution support, 20% monitoring/scanning. Further analytical validation cycles have negative expected value unless they directly support execution.
